citation.article-title: Geobacillus toebii sp. nov., a novel thermophilic bacterium isolated from hay compost.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Geobacillus toebii sp. nov.
Geobacillus toebii (to.e'bi.i. N.L. neut. gen. n. toebii derived from toebi, a special farmland compost in Korea, from which the organism was isolated)
Cells are Gram-positive, aerobic rods, 2.0-3.5 μm long and 0.5-0.9 μm wide.
Spores are ellipsoidal, located subterminally to terminally in swollen sporangia.
Growth occurs at 45-70 °C with an optimum of 60 °C.
Growth at 60 °C occurs between pH 6.0 and 9.0, with an optimum pH of about 7.5.
No growth is found at pH values below 6.0 or above 9.0.
Growth is not observed in the presence of 0.02% azide or 5% NaCl.
Acid is produced from D-glucose but not from xylose or mannitol.
The major cellular fatty acids are iso-C15:0 and iso-C17:0.
The G­C content is 43.9 mol% (as determined by HPLC).
Isolated from farmland compost in Kongju, Korea.
The type strain is strain SK-1T (=KCTC 0306BPT=DSM 14590T).
